intro: Nemesia aurantia, commonly known as the golden nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its delicate appearance and vibrant color make it a favored ornamental plant in temperate climates.
